qas.question: When did the NFL limit teams to 9 preseason games?
What country's teams did US teams sometimes play exhibition games against in the 1980s?
In what year did the NHL play against World Hockey Association teams?
Where is Time Warner Cable Arena?
What hockey arena is in Ontario, California?

plausible_answers.text: National Hockey League collective bargaining agreement

qas.question: What agreement limits teams to nine postseason games?
During what years did AHL teams plate exhibition games against the Soviet Union?
Who did NHL teams play against in postseason training?

plausible_answers.text: cities without their own NHL teams,

qas.question: Where did the AHL sometimes schedule exhibition games
What Canadian city got of protein in 1995?

context: Under the <a0_0>1995–2004<a0_0/> <b5_0>National Hockey League collective bargaining agreement<b5_0/>, teams were limited to nine preseason games. From <b6_0>1975 to 1991<b6_0/>, NHL teams sometimes played exhibition games against teams from the <a1_0>Soviet Union<a1_0/> in the Super Series, and in <a2_0>1978<a2_0/>, played against <b7_0>World Hockey Association teams<b7_0/> also in preseason training. Like the NFL, the NHL sometimes schedules exhibition games for <b8_0>cities without their own NHL teams,<b8_0/> often at a club's minor league affiliate (e.g. Carolina Hurricanes games at Time Warner Cable Arena in <a3_0>Charlotte<a3_0/>, home of their AHL affiliate; Los Angeles Kings games at <a4_0>Citizens Business Bank Arena<a4_0/> in Ontario, California, home of their ECHL affiliate; Montreal Canadiens games at Colisée Pepsi in <b9_0>Quebec City<b9_0/>, which has no pro hockey but used to have an NHL team until 1995; Washington Capitals at 1st Mariner Arena in the Baltimore Hockey Classic; various Western Canada teams at Credit Union Centre in Saskatoon, a potential NHL expansion venue). Since the 2000s, some preseason games have been played in Europe against European teams, as part of the NHL Challenge and NHL Premiere series. In addition to the standard preseason, there also exist prospect tournaments such as the Vancouver Canucks' YoungStars tournament and the Detroit Red Wings' training camp, in which NHL teams' younger prospects face off against each other under their parent club's banner.
